node1.question: Physical symptoms are intentionally produced or feigned

node2.question: The deceptive behavior is evident even in the absence of obvious external rewards

node3.question: Due to the direct physiological effects of a substance (including medication)
node3.yes_branch: SUBSTANCE INTOXICATION; SUBSTANCE WITHDRAWAL; OTHER ADVERSE EFFECT OF MEDICATION

node4.question: Associated with delusions involving bodily functions or sensations
node4.yes_branch: Psychotic Disorder (see Delusions Tree [2.5] for differential diagnosis)

node5.question: Development of a symptom or deficit affecting voluntary motor or sensory function that is not better explained by a neurological or other medical condition or mental disorder

node6.question: Preoccupation with imagined defects or flaws in physical appearance that are not observable to others

node7.question: Occurring as part of an abrupt surge of intense fear or discomfort that reaches a peak within minutes
node7.yes_branch: PANIC ATTACK (see Panic Attacks Tree [2.14] for differential diagnosis)

node8.question: Somatic symptoms (e.g., dry mouth, palpitations) accompanying anxiety that is part of an Anxiety Disorder
node8.yes_branch: Anxiety Disorders (see Anxiety Tree [2.13] for differential diagnosis)

node9.question: High level of anxiety about health

node10.question: Accompanied by one or more somatic symptoms that are distressing or that disrupt everyday life

node11.question: Preoccupation with having or acquiring a serious illness

node12.question: The belief that one has a serious illness is held with delusional intensity
node12.yes_branch: Psychotic Disorder (see Delusions Tree [2.5] for differential diagnosis)

node13.question: One or more somatic symptoms that are distressing or disrupt everyday life

node14.question: Accompanied by disproportionate thoughts about seriousness of illness or excessive time and energy devoted to symptoms

node15.question: A general medical condition is present, and psychological factors adversely affect the medical condition
node15.yes_branch: PSYCHOLOGICAL FACTORS AFFECTING OTHER MEDICAL CONDITION (3.9.4)

node16.question: Clinically significant somatic complaints that interfere with functioning and represent a psychological dysfunction in the individual

node17.question: Occurring in response to a psychosocial stressor
node17.no_branch: OTHER SPECIFIED SOMATIC SYMPTOM AND RELATED DISORDER; UNSPECIFIED SOMATIC SYMPTOM AND RELATED DISORDER
